memberdef.argsstring: (std::FILE *f, const text_style &ts, const S &format, basic_format_args< buffer_context< Char >> args)
memberdef.name: vprint

memberdef.argsstring: (std::FILE *f, const text_style &ts, const S &format_str, const Args &... args)
memberdef.name: print

detaileddescription.para: Formats a string and prints it to the specified file stream using ANSI escape sequences to specify text formatting. Example: fmt::print(fmt::emphasis::bold | fg(fmt::color::red), "Elapsed time: {0:.2f} seconds", 1.23);

memberdef.argsstring: (const text_style &ts, const S &format_str, const Args &... args)
memberdef.name: print

detaileddescription.para: Formats a string and prints it to stdout using ANSI escape sequences to specify text formatting. Example: fmt::print(fmt::emphasis::bold | fg(fmt::color::red), "Elapsed time: {0:.2f} seconds", 1.23);

memberdef.argsstring: (const text_style &ts, const S &format_str, basic_format_args< buffer_context< type_identity_t< Char >>> args)
memberdef.name: vformat

memberdef.argsstring: (const text_style &ts, const S &format_str, const Args &... args)
memberdef.name: format

detaileddescription.para: \rst Formats arguments and returns the result as a string using ANSI escape sequences to specify text formatting.
#include <fmt/color.h> std::string message = fmt::format(fmt::emphasis::bold | fg(fmt::color::red), "The answer is {}", 42); \endrst
